intro: Pilgerochloa eigiana, commonly known as the blue false indigo, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant produces striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Pilgerochloa eigiana is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
